page.title: 10CHELMARSH RESERVOIR
page.content: The reservoir was built in 1965.It is used for storing water pumped out of the River Severn. It then goes across the river via huge pipes to the water filtration works where it is purified before entering the domestic water supply. Before it was built there was just a marshy area in a shallow valley.Huge diggers deepened the valley and now it looks very attractive.There is a sailing club from which members can sail their little boats called dinghies. There is a small colony of herons which nest in the wood alongside the reservoir and other visitors include Canada geese,mallard, tufted duck,great crested grebe and cormorants.Fish include trout,eel,barbel and chub.
